topic.title: Transfer Procedure: External Permissive Signal Only

body.p: If an external permissive signal is to release the SKRU key, power source synchronization must be independently verified. The PDU does not check sources for synchronization through the SYNC screen; however, the operator must still touch the SYNC screen button to release the SKRU key.
Assuming the active source = Source 1, follow these steps:

li.p: An external permissive signal must be issued to enable the SKRU key release.

The operator should:
bring up the Color Monitor SYNC screen,
touch KEY RELEASE on the Color Monitor SYNC screen to release the SKRU key, and
turn the SKRU key and remove it.

The operator should then
insert the key in the lock for the main breaker of the inactive power source (Source 2),
turn the key, and
close the breaker. At this point, both synchronized voltage sources are feeding the PDU.

Open the circuit breaker on Source 1.
Open the circuit breaker for the previously active power source that you are turning off.
Turn the key to lock the breaker.
Remove the key from the Source 1 circuit breaker, insert it into the SKRU lock, and turn the key.

body.p: At this point only Source 2 is feeding the PDU, and Kirk Key locks prevent any inadvertent change of sources.
